Package io.crums.sldg.db

Class CompactFileLedger

java.lang.Object
io.crums.sldg.Ledger
io.crums.sldg.CompactLedger
io.crums.sldg.db.CompactFileLedger
All Implemented Interfaces:
io.crums.util.hash.Digest, java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable
public class CompactFileLedger
extends CompactLedger
A ledger with backing storage on the file system.

    • CompactFileLedger

      public CompactFileLedger​(java.io.File file, io.crums.io.Opening mode, boolean lazy) throws java.io.IOException
      Creates a new or loads an existing ledger at the given file path with the given opening mode.

      By default, Row instances are not lazily loaded, i.e. they're pre-loaded, since if the row is to be serialized externally anyway, it's better to fetch the data immediately while "disk" caches are still hot. If the user however is just scanning rows, then the lazy version generally performs better.

      Parameters:
      file - path to a regular file
      mode - non-null
      lazy - if true then the row's hashpointers are lazily loaded (false by default)
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

  • Method Details

    • getRow

      public Row getRow​(long rowNumber)
      Description copied from class: Ledger
      Returns the row with the given number.
      Overrides:
      getRow in class CompactLedger
      Parameters:
      rowNumber - positive (> 0), since the sentinel row is abstract (a row whose hash is identically zero)
      Returns:
      non-null
